fâ€²â¢(t)=(qlnâˆ’plâ¢qln)â¢(âˆ’nâ¢qlâˆ’nâ¢tâ¢lnâ¡ql+1)superscriptğ‘“â€²ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘™superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘›ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘›ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘ğ‘™1\begin{split}f^{\prime}(t)&=\left(q_{l}^{n}-p_{l}q_{l}^{n}\right)\left(-nq_{l}% ^{-nt}\ln q_{l}+1\right)\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_CELL start_CELL = ( italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( - italic_n italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ln italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 ) end_CELL end_ROW

Considering gâ¢(t)=fâ¢(t)âˆ’tğ‘”ğ‘¡ğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘¡g(t)=f(t)-titalic_g ( italic_t ) = italic_f ( italic_t ) - italic_t then,

gâ€²â¢(t)=(qlnâˆ’plâ¢qln)â¢(âˆ’nâ¢qlâˆ’nâ¢tâ¢lnâ¡ql+1)âˆ’1=(1âˆ’pl)â¢qlnâ¢(âˆ’nâ¢qlâˆ’nâ¢tâ¢lnâ¡ql+1)âˆ’1superscriptğ‘”â€²ğ‘¡superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘›subscriptğ‘ğ‘™superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘›ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘›ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘ğ‘™111subscriptğ‘ğ‘™superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘›ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘›ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘ğ‘™11\begin{split}g^{\prime}(t)&=\left(q_{l}^{n}-p_{l}q_{l}^{n}\right)\left(-nq_{l}% ^{-nt}\ln q_{l}+1\right)-1\\ &=(1-p_{l})q_{l}^{n}(-nq_{l}^{-nt}\ln q_{l}+1)-1\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_CELL start_CELL = ( italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( - italic_n italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ln italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 ) - 1 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( - italic_n italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ln italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + 1 ) - 1 end_CELL end_ROW

For simplicity, we use pğ‘pitalic_p and qğ‘qitalic_q instead of plsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™p_{l}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and qlsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™q_{l}italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT When gâ€²â¢(t)=0superscriptğ‘”â€²ğ‘¡0g^{\prime}(t)=0italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = 0, we can dervie that:

âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qnâ¢nâ¢qâˆ’nâ¢tâ¢lnâ¡q=1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qn1ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘¡ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›\displaystyle-(1-p)q^{n}nq^{-nt}\ln q=1-(1-p)q^{n}- ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_ln italic_q = 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
qâˆ’nâ¢t=1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qn(pâˆ’1)â¢qnâ¢nâ¢lnâ¡qsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘¡11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘1superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘\displaystyle q^{-nt}=\frac{1-(1-p)q^{n}}{(p-1)q^{n}n\ln q}italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n italic_t end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG
âˆ’nâ¢tâ¢lnâ¡q=lnâ¡(1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qn)âˆ’lnâ¡((pâˆ’1)â¢qnâ¢nâ¢lnâ¡q)ğ‘›ğ‘¡ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘1superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘\displaystyle-nt\ln q=\ln\left(1-(1-p)q^{n}\right)-\ln\left((p-1)q^{n}n\ln q\right)- italic_n italic_t roman_ln italic_q = roman_ln ( 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - roman_ln ( ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n roman_ln italic_q )
t=lnâ¡((pâˆ’1)â¢qnâ¢nâ¢lnâ¡q)âˆ’lnâ¡(1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qn)nâ¢lnâ¡qğ‘¡ğ‘1superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘\displaystyle t=\frac{\ln\left((p-1)q^{n}n\ln q\right)-\ln\left(1-(1-p)q^{n}% \right)}{n\ln q}italic_t = divide start_ARG roman_ln ( ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n roman_ln italic_q ) - roman_ln ( 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG
t=nâ¢lnâ¡q+lnâ¡((pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡q)âˆ’lnâ¡(1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qn)nâ¢lnâ¡qğ‘¡ğ‘›ğ‘ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘\displaystyle t=\frac{n\ln q+\ln\left((p-1)n\ln q\right)-\ln\left(1-(1-p)q^{n}% \right)}{n\ln q}italic_t = divide start_ARG italic_n roman_ln italic_q + roman_ln ( ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q ) - roman_ln ( 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG
t=1+lnâ¡(pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡q1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qnnâ¢lnâ¡qğ‘¡1ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘\displaystyle t=1+\frac{\ln\frac{(p-1)n\ln q}{1-(1-p)q^{n}}}{n\ln q}italic_t = 1 + divide start_ARG roman_ln divide start_ARG ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG

It is easy to see that fâ€²â¢(t)superscriptğ‘“â€²ğ‘¡f^{\prime}(t)italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) is monotonically increasing with tğ‘¡titalic_t and fâ€²â¢(t)>0superscriptğ‘“â€²ğ‘¡0f^{\prime}(t)>0italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) > 0, so when t<1+lnâ¡(pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡q1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qnnâ¢lnâ¡qğ‘¡1ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘t<1+\frac{\ln\frac{(p-1)n\ln q}{1-(1-p)q^{n}}}{n\ln q}italic_t < 1 + divide start_ARG roman_ln divide start_ARG ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG, fâ€²â¢(t)<1superscriptğ‘“â€²ğ‘¡1f^{\prime}(t)<1italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) < 1 and reversely, when t>1+lnâ¡(pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡q1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qnnâ¢lnâ¡qğ‘¡1ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘t>1+\frac{\ln\frac{(p-1)n\ln q}{1-(1-p)q^{n}}}{n\ln q}italic_t > 1 + divide start_ARG roman_ln divide start_ARG ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG, fâ€²â¢(t)>1superscriptğ‘“â€²ğ‘¡1f^{\prime}(t)>1italic_f start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t ) > 1.

So gâ¢(t)=fâ¢(t)âˆ’tğ‘”ğ‘¡ğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘¡g(t)=f(t)-titalic_g ( italic_t ) = italic_f ( italic_t ) - italic_t will decrease first and increase later, and gâ¢(0)=fâ¢(0)âˆ’0=fâ¢(0)=plâ‰¥0ğ‘”0ğ‘“00ğ‘“0subscriptğ‘ğ‘™0g(0)=f(0)-0=f(0)=p_{l}\geq 0italic_g ( 0 ) = italic_f ( 0 ) - 0 = italic_f ( 0 ) = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, and gâ¢(1)=0ğ‘”10g(1)=0italic_g ( 1 ) = 0. And the question is, is there a chance that gâ¢(t)<0ğ‘”ğ‘¡0g(t)<0italic_g ( italic_t ) < 0, which means that the nodes erased in layer lğ‘™litalic_l is fewer that layer l+1ğ‘™1l+1italic_l + 1? In this case, the fission reaction can reach a bound, otherwise, the fission continues until it erase all nodes.

Apparently, if lnâ¡(pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡q1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qnnâ¢lnâ¡q>=0ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘0\frac{\ln\frac{(p-1)n\ln q}{1-(1-p)q^{n}}}{n\ln q}>=0divide start_ARG roman_ln divide start_ARG ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG > = 0, then 1111 will be the first zero-point of gâ¢(t)ğ‘”ğ‘¡g(t)italic_g ( italic_t ) because gâ¢(t)ğ‘”ğ‘¡g(t)italic_g ( italic_t ) monotonically decreases with tğ‘¡titalic_t, so gâ¢(t)>=0ğ‘”ğ‘¡0g(t)>=0italic_g ( italic_t ) > = 0 with tâˆˆ[0,1]ğ‘¡01t\in[0,1]italic_t âˆˆ [ 0 , 1 ]. Otherwise, if lnâ¡(pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡q1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qnnâ¢lnâ¡q<0ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘0\frac{\ln\frac{(p-1)n\ln q}{1-(1-p)q^{n}}}{n\ln q}<0divide start_ARG roman_ln divide start_ARG ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG < 0, then, gâ¢(t)ğ‘”ğ‘¡g(t)italic_g ( italic_t ) decreases first and increases, and let gâ€²â¢(t^)=0superscriptğ‘”â€²^ğ‘¡0g^{\prime}(\hat{t})=0italic_g start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG ) = 0, we have gâ¢(t^)<0ğ‘”^ğ‘¡0g(\hat{t})<0italic_g ( over^ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG ) < 0, then 1111 will be the second zero-point, so gâ¢(t)ğ‘”ğ‘¡g(t)italic_g ( italic_t ) could be smaller than 0 with tâˆˆ[0,1]ğ‘¡01t\in[0,1]italic_t âˆˆ [ 0 , 1 ].

Apparently nâ¢lnâ¡q<0ğ‘›ğ‘0n\ln q<0italic_n roman_ln italic_q < 0, so with lnâ¡(pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡q1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qn>0ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›0\ln\frac{(p-1)n\ln q}{1-(1-p)q^{n}}>0roman_ln divide start_ARG ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG > 0, then gâ¢(t)ğ‘”ğ‘¡g(t)italic_g ( italic_t ) could be smaller than 0 with tâˆˆ[0,1]ğ‘¡01t\in[0,1]italic_t âˆˆ [ 0 , 1 ].

lnâ¡(pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡q1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qn>0ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›0\displaystyle\ln\frac{(p-1)n\ln q}{1-(1-p)q^{n}}>0roman_ln divide start_ARG ( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG start_ARG 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG > 0
(pâˆ’1)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡qâˆ’(1âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢qn)>0ğ‘1ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›0\displaystyle(p-1)n\ln q-\left(1-(1-p)q^{n}\right)>0( italic_p - 1 ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q - ( 1 - ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > 0
âˆ’(1âˆ’p)â¢nâ¢lnâ¡qâˆ’1+(1âˆ’p)â¢qn>01ğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›0\displaystyle-(1-p)n\ln q-1+(1-p)q^{n}>0- ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_n roman_ln italic_q - 1 + ( 1 - italic_p ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > 0
(1âˆ’p)â¢(qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡q)>11ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘1\displaystyle(1-p)(q^{n}-n\ln q)>1( 1 - italic_p ) ( italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q ) > 1
1âˆ’p>1qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡q1ğ‘1superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘\displaystyle 1-p>\frac{1}{q^{n}-n\ln q}1 - italic_p > divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG
p<1âˆ’1qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡qğ‘11superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘\displaystyle p<1-\frac{1}{q^{n}-n\ln q}italic_p < 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG

Therefore, when p<1âˆ’1qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡qğ‘11superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘p<1-\frac{1}{q^{n}-n\ln q}italic_p < 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG, there exists gâ¢(t)<0ğ‘”ğ‘¡0g(t)<0italic_g ( italic_t ) < 0, and when p>=1âˆ’1qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡qğ‘11superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘p>=1-\frac{1}{q^{n}-n\ln q}italic_p > = 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG, gâ¢(t)>=0ğ‘”ğ‘¡0g(t)>=0italic_g ( italic_t ) > = 0

When gâ¢(t)<0ğ‘”ğ‘¡0g(t)<0italic_g ( italic_t ) < 0, it means that fâ¢(t)<tğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘¡f(t)<titalic_f ( italic_t ) < italic_t, so for layer lğ‘™litalic_l, the number of erased nodes is smaller than layer l+1ğ‘™1l+1italic_l + 1. So the fission reaction fail, and there is a threshold for the number of erased number, the threshold is the first zero-point of gâ¢(t)ğ‘”ğ‘¡g(t)italic_g ( italic_t ).

Theorem A.1 (fission of RAG).

For layer lğ‘™litalic_l, if the retrival probability pl<1âˆ’1qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡qsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™11superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘p_{l}<1-\frac{1}{q^{n}-n\ln q}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG, then there exists x^âˆˆ(0,1)^ğ‘¥01\hat{x}\in(0,1)over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG âˆˆ ( 0 , 1 ) satisfying gâ¢(x^)=0ğ‘”^ğ‘¥0g(\hat{x})=0italic_g ( over^ start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ) = 0.

Apparently, for lower levels of the tree, the connection is tighter and the retrieval is harder, therefore, it is impossible that pl>=1âˆ’1qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡qsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™11superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘p_{l}>=1-\frac{1}{q^{n}-n\ln q}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > = 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG satisfies, so for lower levels, tl<tl+1subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘™subscriptğ‘¡ğ‘™1t_{l}<t_{l+1}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. When the level gets higher, the retrieval becomes easier and the connection is sparser, so it is more likely to satisfy that pl>=1âˆ’1qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡qsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™11superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘p_{l}>=1-\frac{1}{q^{n}-n\ln q}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > = 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG. Therefore, with RAG, we can greatly erase the computation of first layers and even erase the whole layer which increases the expressive power of transformer.

A.2 Proof of Theorem 2.5

To assess whether tğ‘¡titalic_t converges to t^^ğ‘¡\hat{t}over^ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG, we conducted a simulation experiment with 10 repetitions, where plâˆ¼Nâ¢(0.8âˆ’0.06â¢l,0.01)similar-tosubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘0.80.06ğ‘™0.01p_{l}\sim N(0.8-0.06l,0.01)italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_N ( 0.8 - 0.06 italic_l , 0.01 ), qlâˆ¼Nâ¢(0.8âˆ’0.06â¢l,0.01)similar-tosubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘0.80.06ğ‘™0.01q_{l}\sim N(0.8-0.06l,0.01)italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_N ( 0.8 - 0.06 italic_l , 0.01 ), and nlâˆ¼Nâ¢(16âˆ’1.4â¢l,0.01)similar-tosubscriptğ‘›ğ‘™ğ‘161.4ğ‘™0.01n_{l}\sim N(16-1.4l,0.01)italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ¼ italic_N ( 16 - 1.4 italic_l , 0.01 ), where lğ‘™litalic_l represents the layer index. As depicted in figure 4, it is observed that tğ‘¡titalic_t is quite close to the corresponding t^^ğ‘¡\hat{t}over^ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG, the critical point where the fission reaction stops, therefore, with high probability tâ‰ˆt^ğ‘¡^ğ‘¡t\approx\hat{t}italic_t â‰ˆ over^ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG. Also we can notice that the variance in higher layers are quite large, this means that with probability that we happen to retrieve some information quite close to the answer, then we can erase the higher layers, but in normal cases, we can only reduce the lower layers. Also, the critical point decreases when the layer index increases, showing that we can replace more nodes in the lower levels. But due to the large number of nodes, replacing the whole layer is also a tricky problem.

Assumption A.2.

The probability of erasing in layer lğ‘™litalic_l satisfies tlâ‰ˆzlsubscriptğ‘¡ğ‘™subscriptğ‘§ğ‘™t_{l}\approx z_{l}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰ˆ italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, zlsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘™z_{l}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the first zero point of gâ¢(t)ğ‘”ğ‘¡g(t)italic_g ( italic_t ).

For simplicity, we use zğ‘§zitalic_z instead of zlsubscriptğ‘§ğ‘™z_{l}italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and gâ¢(z)=0ğ‘”ğ‘§0g(z)=0italic_g ( italic_z ) = 0,

(qnâˆ’pâ¢qn)â¢(qâˆ’nâ¢zâˆ’1+z)+pâˆ’z=0superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘§1ğ‘§ğ‘ğ‘§0\displaystyle\left(q^{n}-pq^{n}\right)\left(q^{-nz}-1+z\right)+p-z=0( italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_p italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ( italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n italic_z end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 + italic_z ) + italic_p - italic_z = 0
âˆ’(qâˆ’nâ¢zâˆ’1+z)â¢qnâ¢p+p+qnâˆ’nâ¢zâˆ’qn+qnâ¢zâˆ’z=0superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘§1ğ‘§superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘§superscriptğ‘ğ‘›superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘§ğ‘§0\displaystyle-\left(q^{-nz}-1+z\right)q^{n}p+p+q^{n-nz}-q^{n}+q^{n}z-z=0- ( italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n italic_z end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 + italic_z ) italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p + italic_p + italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - italic_n italic_z end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z - italic_z = 0

(qnâˆ’qnâˆ’nâ¢zâˆ’qnâ¢z+1)â¢p=qnâˆ’qnâˆ’nâ¢zâˆ’qnâ¢z+zsuperscriptğ‘ğ‘›superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘§superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘§1ğ‘superscriptğ‘ğ‘›superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘§superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘§ğ‘§\displaystyle\left(q^{n}-q^{n-nz}-q^{n}z+1\right)p=q^{n}-q^{n-nz}-q^{n}z+z( italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - italic_n italic_z end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z + 1 ) italic_p = italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n - italic_n italic_z end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z + italic_z

Theorem A.3.

With pl<1âˆ’1qnâˆ’nâ¢lnâ¡qsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™11superscriptğ‘ğ‘›ğ‘›ğ‘p_{l}<1-\frac{1}{q^{n}-n\ln q}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 1 - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_n roman_ln italic_q end_ARG, if we want probability Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ that layer lğ‘™litalic_l can be totally covered i.e.,Â rlnâ‰¥Î´superscriptsubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘™ğ‘›ğ›¿r_{l}^{n}\geq\deltaitalic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_Î´, we need plâ‰³1âˆ’Ïµ1âˆ’qÏµâ¢ngreater-than-or-equivalent-tosubscriptğ‘ğ‘™1italic-Ïµ1superscriptğ‘italic-Ïµğ‘›p_{l}\gtrsim 1-\frac{\epsilon}{1-q^{\epsilon n}}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰³ 1 - divide start_ARG italic_Ïµ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_q start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Ïµ italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG, and Ïµâ‰¤1âˆ’Î´nitalic-Ïµ1ğ‘›ğ›¿\epsilon\leq 1-\sqrt[n]{\delta}italic_Ïµ â‰¤ 1 - nth-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG.

Appendix B The Impact of Noise

B.1 Proof of Theorem 3.1

Assumption B.1.

The model conducts filtering before inference, and those information regarded as noise would not be used during inference. When there are Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ percent of relevant tokens and 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta1 - italic_Î´ percent of noise information are included in the inference, let ğ—rsubscriptğ—ğ‘Ÿ{\bm{X}}_{r}bold_italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ğ—nsubscriptğ—ğ‘›{\bm{X}}_{n}bold_italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT represents the relevant tokens and noise, ğ—ğ—{\bm{X}}bold_italic_X represents the input to the inference, then Iâ¢(ğ—r;ğ—)=Î´â¢Hâ¢(ğ—)ğ¼subscriptğ—ğ‘Ÿğ—ğ›¿ğ»ğ—I({\bm{X}}_{r};{\bm{X}})=\delta H({\bm{X}})italic_I ( bold_italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_X ) = italic_Î´ italic_H ( bold_italic_X ) and Iâ¢(ğ—n;ğ—)=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢Hâ¢(ğ—)ğ¼subscriptğ—ğ‘›ğ—1ğ›¿ğ»ğ—I({\bm{X}}_{n};{\bm{X}})=(1-\delta)H({\bm{X}})italic_I ( bold_italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_X ) = ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_H ( bold_italic_X )

Assume that there are Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ percent of tokens are actually related to the query, and other 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta1 - italic_Î´ percent tokens are distractions. In addition, with probability pesubscriptğ‘ğ‘’p_{e}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT the model mistakenly classify is the document relevant or not. Then, after filtering, Î´â‹…(1âˆ’pe)â‹…ğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘’\delta\cdot(1-p_{e})italic_Î´ â‹… ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) percent of relevant tokens and (1âˆ’Î´)â‹…peâ‹…1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’(1-\delta)\cdot p_{e}( 1 - italic_Î´ ) â‹… italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT distractions are left in the input. Then the percentage of distraction is,

Î±=(1âˆ’Î´)â‹…pe(1âˆ’Î´)â‹…pe+Î´â‹…(1âˆ’pe)=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pepe+Î´âˆ’2â¢Î´â¢pe=1âˆ’Î´Î´peâˆ’2â¢Î´+1ğ›¼â‹…1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’â‹…1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’â‹…ğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘’1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ›¿2ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’1ğ›¿ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’2ğ›¿1\alpha=\frac{(1-\delta)\cdot p_{e}}{(1-\delta)\cdot p_{e}+\delta\cdot(1-p_{e})% }=\frac{(1-\delta)p_{e}}{p_{e}+\delta-2\delta p_{e}}=\frac{1-\delta}{\frac{% \delta}{p_{e}}-2\delta+1}italic_Î± = divide start_ARG ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) â‹… italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) â‹… italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Î´ â‹… ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG = divide start_ARG ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Î´ - 2 italic_Î´ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = divide start_ARG 1 - italic_Î´ end_ARG start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_Î´ end_ARG start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - 2 italic_Î´ + 1 end_ARG

Based on Fanoâ€™s inequality, peâ‰¥Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’›)âˆ’1Hâ¢(ğ’˜)subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ»conditionalğ’˜ğ’›1ğ»ğ’˜p_{e}\geq\frac{H({\bm{w}}|{\bm{z}})-1}{H({\bm{w}})}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w | bold_italic_z ) - 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) end_ARG, ğ’›ğ’›{\bm{z}}bold_italic_z is the embedding obtained by transformer, and we assume that ğ’”ğ’”{\bm{s}}bold_italic_s is the information we need to extract from document for further generation, ğ’˜ğ’˜{\bm{w}}bold_italic_w is the information to identify the relevance of tokens.

Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’›)=Hâ¢(ğ’˜)âˆ’Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’›)ğ»conditionalğ’˜ğ’›ğ»ğ’˜ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’›\displaystyle H({\bm{w}}|{\bm{z}})=H({\bm{w}})-I({\bm{w}};{\bm{z}})italic_H ( bold_italic_w | bold_italic_z ) = italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) - italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_z )
peâ‰¥Hâ¢(ğ’˜)âˆ’Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’›)âˆ’1Hâ¢(ğ’˜)subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ»ğ’˜ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’›1ğ»ğ’˜\displaystyle p_{e}\geq\frac{H({\bm{w}})-I({\bm{w}};{\bm{z}})-1}{H({\bm{w}})}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) - italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_z ) - 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) end_ARG
Î±â‰¥1âˆ’Î´Î´â¢Hâ¢(ğ’˜)Hâ¢(ğ’˜)âˆ’Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’›)âˆ’1âˆ’2â¢Î´+1ğ›¼1ğ›¿ğ›¿ğ»ğ’˜ğ»ğ’˜ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’›12ğ›¿1\displaystyle\alpha\geq\frac{1-\delta}{\frac{\delta H({\bm{w}})}{H({\bm{w}})-I% ({\bm{w}};{\bm{z}})-1}-2\delta+1}italic_Î± â‰¥ divide start_ARG 1 - italic_Î´ end_ARG start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_Î´ italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) - italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_z ) - 1 end_ARG - 2 italic_Î´ + 1 end_ARG
Theorem B.2 (Theorem 1 of Kawaguchi etÂ al. (2023)).

Let lâˆˆ{1,â€¦,D}ğ‘™1â€¦ğ·l\in\{1,\dots,D\}italic_l âˆˆ { 1 , â€¦ , italic_D }. Suppose that Ï•lssubscriptsuperscriptitalic-Ï•ğ‘ ğ‘™\phi^{s}_{l}italic_Ï• start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_s end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is fixed independently of the training dataset sğ‘ sitalic_s. Then, for any Î´>0ğ›¿0\delta>0italic_Î´ > 0, with probability at least 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta1 - italic_Î´, the following holds:

Î”â¢(s)â‰¤G3lâ¢Iâ¢(X;Zl|Y)â¢lnâ¡(2)+G2ln+G1lâ¢(0)n,Î”ğ‘ superscriptsubscriptğº3ğ‘™ğ¼ğ‘‹conditionalsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™ğ‘Œ2superscriptsubscriptğº2ğ‘™ğ‘›superscriptsubscriptğº1ğ‘™0ğ‘›\displaystyle\Delta(s)\leq G_{3}^{l}\sqrt{\frac{I(X;Z_{l}|Y)\ln(2)+G_{2}^{l}}{% n}}+\frac{G_{1}^{l}(0)}{\sqrt{n}},roman_Î” ( italic_s ) â‰¤ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_I ( italic_X ; italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Y ) roman_ln ( 2 ) + italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_ARG ,

where G1lâ¢(0)=ğ’ªâ¢(1)superscriptsubscriptğº1ğ‘™0ğ’ª1G_{1}^{l}(0)=\mathcal{O}(1)italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) = caligraphic_O ( 1 ), G2l=ğ’ªâ¢(1)superscriptsubscriptğº2ğ‘™ğ’ª1G_{2}^{l}=\mathcal{O}(1)italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = caligraphic_O ( 1 ), and G3l=ğ’ªâ¢(1)superscriptsubscriptğº3ğ‘™ğ’ª1G_{3}^{l}=\mathcal{O}(1)italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = caligraphic_O ( 1 ), as nâ†’âˆâ†’ğ‘›n\rightarrow\inftyitalic_n â†’ âˆ.

The theorem above regard the first lğ‘™litalic_l layers of a model as a encoder, and the rest as decoder. In LLM, we encode the token embeddings one by one and then decode from those encoded embedding to generate new tokens. In this way, Zlsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™Z_{l}italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is actually the output embeddings of tokens, and Iâ¢(X;Z|Y)=Hâ¢(ğ’d)=Î±1âˆ’Î±â¢Hâ¢(ğ’r)ğ¼ğ‘‹conditionalğ‘ğ‘Œğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘‘ğ›¼1ğ›¼ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘ŸI(X;Z|Y)=H({\bm{Z}}_{d})=\frac{\alpha}{1-\alpha}H({\bm{Z}}_{r})italic_I ( italic_X ; italic_Z | italic_Y ) = italic_H ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG italic_Î± end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Î± end_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), where Hâ¢(ğ’d)ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘‘H({\bm{Z}}_{d})italic_H ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) stands for the entropy of those distracting tokens and Hâ¢(ğ’r)ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘ŸH({\bm{Z}}_{r})italic_H ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) stands for the entropy of those relevant tokens.

Î±1âˆ’Î±=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pepe+Î´âˆ’2â¢Î´â¢peâ‹…pe+Î´âˆ’2â¢Î´â¢pepe+Î´âˆ’2â¢Î´â¢peâˆ’(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pe=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pepe+Î´âˆ’2â¢Î´â¢peâˆ’(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pe=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢peÎ´âˆ’Î´â¢pe=1âˆ’Î´Î´peâˆ’Î´ğ›¼1ğ›¼â‹…1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ›¿2ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ›¿2ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ›¿2ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ›¿2ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ›¿ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’1ğ›¿ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘’ğ›¿\begin{split}\frac{\alpha}{1-\alpha}&=\frac{(1-\delta)p_{e}}{p_{e}+\delta-2% \delta p_{e}}\cdot\frac{p_{e}+\delta-2\delta p_{e}}{p_{e}+\delta-2\delta p_{e}% -(1-\delta)p_{e}}\\ &=\frac{(1-\delta)p_{e}}{p_{e}+\delta-2\delta p_{e}-(1-\delta)p_{e}}\\ &=\frac{(1-\delta)p_{e}}{\delta-\delta p_{e}}=\frac{1-\delta}{\frac{\delta}{p_% {e}}-\delta}\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL divide start_ARG italic_Î± end_ARG start_ARG 1 - then, if we assume that the model can perfectly take advantage of existing information

Iâ¢(X;Z|Y)=Î±1âˆ’Î±â‹…Hâ¢(ğ’r)=((1âˆ’Î´)â¢(Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’›)âˆ’1)Î´â¢(Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’›)+1))â‹…Hâ¢(ğ’r)ğ¼ğ‘‹conditionalğ‘ğ‘Œâ‹…ğ›¼1ğ›¼ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘Ÿâ‹…1ğ›¿ğ»conditionalğ’˜ğ’›1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’›1ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘Ÿ\begin{split}I(X;Z|Y)&=\frac{\alpha}{1-\alpha}\cdot H({\bm{Z}}_{r})\\ &=\left(\frac{(1-\delta)(H({\bm{w}}|{\bm{z}})-1)}{\delta(I({\bm{w}};{\bm{z}})+% 1)}\right)\cdot H({\bm{Z}}_{r})\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_I ( italic_X ; italic_Z | italic_Y ) end_CELL start_CELL = divide start_ARG italic_Î± end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Î± end_ARG â‹… italic_H ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( divide start_ARG ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) ( italic_H ( bold_italic_w | bold_italic_z ) - 1 ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ ( italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_z ) + 1 ) end_ARG ) â‹… italic_H ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW (5)

Using Theorem B.2, we can observe that,

Î”â¢(s)â‰¤G3â¢Iâ¢(X;Z|Y)â¢lnâ¡(2)+G2n+G1â¢(0)nâ‰¤G3â¢Iâ¢(X;Z|Y)â¢lnâ¡(2)n+G2n+G1â¢(0)n=c1â¢Iâ¢(X;Z|Y)+c2=c1â¢((1âˆ’Î´)â¢(Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’›)âˆ’1)Î´â¢(Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’›)+1))â‹…Hâ¢(ğ’r)+c2â‰¤c1â¢((1âˆ’Î´)â¢Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’›)Î´â¢(Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’›)+1))â‹…Hâ¢(ğ’r)+c2Î”ğ‘ subscriptğº3ğ¼ğ‘‹conditionalğ‘ğ‘Œ2subscriptğº2ğ‘›subscriptğº10ğ‘›subscriptğº3ğ¼ğ‘‹conditionalğ‘ğ‘Œ2ğ‘›subscriptğº2ğ‘›subscriptğº10ğ‘›subscriptğ‘1ğ¼ğ‘‹conditionalğ‘ğ‘Œsubscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘1â‹…1ğ›¿ğ»conditionalğ’˜ğ’›1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’›1ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘1â‹…1ğ›¿ğ»conditionalğ’˜ğ’›ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’›1ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘2\begin{split}\Delta(s)&\leq G_{3}\sqrt{\frac{I(X;Z|Y)\ln(2)+G_{2}}{n}}+\frac{G% _{1}(0)}{\sqrt{n}}\\ &\leq G_{3}\sqrt{\frac{I(X;Z|Y)\ln(2)}{n}}+\sqrt{\frac{G_{2}}{n}}+\frac{G_{1}(% 0)}{\sqrt{n}}\\ &=c_{1}\sqrt{I(X;Z|Y)}+c_{2}\\ &=c_{1}\sqrt{\left(\frac{(1-\delta)(H({\bm{w}}|{\bm{z}})-1)}{\delta(I({\bm{w}}% ;{\bm{z}})+1)}\right)\cdot H({\bm{Z}}_{r})}+c_{2}\\ &\leq c_{1}\sqrt{\left(\frac{(1-\delta)H({\bm{w}}|{\bm{z}})}{\delta(I({\bm{w}}% ;{\bm{z}})+1)}\right)\cdot H({\bm{Z}}_{r})}+c_{2}\\ \end{split}start_ROW start_CELL roman_Î” ( italic_s ) end_CELL start_CELL â‰¤ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_I ( italic_X ; italic_Z | italic_Y ) roman_ln ( 2 ) + italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL â‰¤ italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_I ( italic_X ; where c1=G3â¢lnâ¡2nsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğº32ğ‘›c_{1}=G_{3}\sqrt{\frac{\ln 2}{n}}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 3 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG roman_ln 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_ARG, c2=G2n+G1â¢(0)nsubscriptğ‘2subscriptğº2ğ‘›subscriptğº10ğ‘›c_{2}=\sqrt{\frac{G_{2}}{n}}+\frac{G_{1}(0)}{\sqrt{n}}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_ARG + divide start_ARG italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_n end_ARG end_ARG

â„’â¢(Î´)âˆ’â„’â¢(1)â‰¤c1â¢((1âˆ’Î´)â¢Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’›)Î´â¢(Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’›)+1))â‹…Hâ¢(ğ’r)+c2,â„’ğ›¿â„’1subscriptğ‘1â‹…1ğ›¿ğ»conditionalğ’˜ğ’›ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’›1ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘2\mathcal{L}(\delta)-\mathcal{L}(1)\leq c_{1}\sqrt{\left(\frac{(1-\delta)H({\bm% {w}}|{\bm{z}})}{\delta(I({\bm{w}};{\bm{z}})+1)}\right)\cdot H({\bm{Z}}_{r})}+c% _{2},caligraphic_L ( italic_Î´ ) - caligraphic_L ( 1 ) â‰¤ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT square-root start_ARG ( divide start_ARG ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_H ( bold_italic_w | bold_italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ ( italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_z ) + 1 ) end_ARG ) â‹… italic_H ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (7)
Theorem B.3 (Impact of Distractions).

Given a set of documents, with Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ percent of related and 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta1 - italic_Î´ percent of distractions. If we assume documents contribute the same, and we ask the LLM to ignore the irrelevant documents, then,

â„’â¢(Î´)âˆ’â„’â¢(1)â‰¤c1â¢((1âˆ’Î´)â¢Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’›)Î´â¢(Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’›)+1))â‹…Hâ¢(ğ’r)+c2,â„’ğ›¿â„’1subscriptğ‘1â‹…1ğ›¿ğ»conditionalğ’˜ğ’›ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’›1ğ»subscriptğ’ğ‘Ÿsubscriptğ‘2\mathcal{L}(\delta)-\mathcal{L}(1)\leq c_{1}\sqrt{\left(\frac{(1-\delta)H({\bm% {w}}|{\bm{z}})}{\delta(I({\bm{w}};{\bm{z}})+1)}\right)\cdot H({\bm{Z}}_{r})}+c% _{2},caligraphic_L ( italic_Î´ ) - caligraphic_L ( 1 ) â‰¤ italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT square-root start_ARG ( divide start_ARG ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_H ( bold_italic_w | bold_italic_z ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ ( italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_z ) + 1 ) end_ARG ) â‹… italic_H ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (8)

where â„’â¢(Î´)â„’ğ›¿\mathcal{L}(\delta)caligraphic_L ( italic_Î´ ) stands for the loss with (1âˆ’Î´)1ğ›¿(1-\delta)( 1 - italic_Î´ ) distractions and â„’â¢(1)â„’1\mathcal{L}(1)caligraphic_L ( 1 ) means the training loss as in the training stage, no distraction is involved. Iâ¢(ğ™d;ğ˜)ğ¼subscriptğ™ğ‘‘ğ˜I({\bm{Z}}_{d};{\bm{Y}})italic_I ( bold_italic_Z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_Y ) is the mutual information between the embedding of related documents and the final embedding, this shows how much does LLM rely on documents during inference.

B.2 Proof of Theorem 3.2

Let aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ¢(xi)=(ğ‘¾qâ¢ğ’™i)Tâ¢ğ‘¾kâ¢ğ‘¿:iğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğ‘›subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¾ğ‘subscriptğ’™ğ‘–ğ‘‡subscriptğ‘¾ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¿:absentğ‘–attn(x_{i})=({\bm{W}}_{q}{\bm{x}}_{i})^{T}{\bm{W}}_{k}{\bm{X}}_{:i}italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the original attention layer of LLM, and aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ€²â¢(xi)=((ğ‘¾q+Î”â¢ğ‘¾q)â¢ğ’™i)Tâ¢(ğ‘¾k+Î”â¢ğ‘¾k)â¢ğ‘¿:iğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘›â€²subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–superscriptsubscriptğ‘¾ğ‘Î”subscriptğ‘¾ğ‘subscriptğ’™ğ‘–ğ‘‡subscriptğ‘¾ğ‘˜Î”subscriptğ‘¾ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¿:absentğ‘–attn^{\prime}(x_{i})=\left(({\bm{W}}_{q}+\Delta{\bm{W}}_{q}){\bm{x}}_{i}\right% )^{T}({\bm{W}}_{k}+\Delta{\bm{W}}_{k}){\bm{X}}_{:i}italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( ( bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Î” bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Î” bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the finetuned one and aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢n^^ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğ‘›\widehat{attn}over^ start_ARG italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n end_ARG be desired function, can we finetune the model to be aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢n^^ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğ‘›\widehat{attn}over^ start_ARG italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n end_ARG?

So we need

sâ¢oâ¢fâ¢tâ¢mâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ€²â¢(ğ‘¿))â¢[i]â‰ˆ{0Â ifÂ â¢âˆƒbâ¢s.t.g1â¢(xi,xb)=0sâ¢oâ¢fâ¢tâ¢mâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ¢(ğ‘¿r))â¢[i]Â elseÂ ğ‘ ğ‘œğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘›â€²ğ‘¿delimited-[]ğ‘–cases0formulae-sequenceÂ ifÂ ğ‘ğ‘ ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘”1subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘0ğ‘ ğ‘œğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğ‘›subscriptğ‘¿ğ‘Ÿdelimited-[]ğ‘–Â elseÂ softmax(attn^{\prime}({\bm{X}}))[i]\approx\begin{cases}0&\text{ if }\ \exists% \ b\ s.t.\ g_{1}(x_{i},x_{b})=0\\ softmax(attn({\bm{X}}_{r}))[i]&\text{ else }\end{cases}italic_s italic_o italic_f italic_t italic_m italic_a italic_x ( italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_X ) ) [ italic_i ] â‰ˆ { start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL if âˆƒ italic_b italic_s . italic_t . italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 0 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_s italic_o italic_f italic_t italic_m italic_a italic_x ( italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n ( bold_italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) [ italic_i ] end_CELL start_CELL else end_CELL end_ROW

where ğ‘¿rsubscriptğ‘¿ğ‘Ÿ{\bm{X}}_{r}bold_italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_r end_POSTSUBSCRIPT means those related tokens. let ğ‘¨i,j=aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ¢(ğ’™i,ğ’™j)=(ğ‘¾qâ¢ğ’™i)Tâ¢ğ‘¾kâ¢ğ’™j=ğ’™iTâ¢ğ‘¾â¢ğ’™jsubscriptğ‘¨ğ‘–ğ‘—ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğ‘›subscriptğ’™ğ‘–subscriptğ’™ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ‘¾ğ‘subscriptğ’™ğ‘–ğ‘‡subscriptğ‘¾ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ’™ğ‘–ğ‘‡ğ‘¾subscriptğ’™ğ‘—{\bm{A}}_{i,j}=attn({\bm{x}}_{i},{\bm{x}}_{j})=({\bm{W}}_{q}{\bm{x}}_{i})^{T}{% \bm{W}}_{k}{\bm{x}}_{j}={\bm{x}}_{i}^{T}{\bm{W}}{\bm{x}}_{j}bold_italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_italic_W bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ€²â¢(ğ’™i,ğ’™j)=((ğ‘¾q+Î”â¢ğ‘¾q)â¢ğ’™i)Tâ¢(ğ‘¾k+Î”â¢ğ‘¾k)â¢ğ’™j=ğ’™iâ¢(ğ‘¾+Î”â¢ğ‘¾)â¢ğ’™j=ğ’™iâ¢ğ‘¾â¢ğ’™j+ğ’™iâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢ğ’™jğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘›â€²subscriptğ’™ğ‘–subscriptğ’™ğ‘—superscriptsubscriptğ‘¾ğ‘Î”subscriptğ‘¾ğ‘subscriptğ’™ğ‘–ğ‘‡subscriptğ‘¾ğ‘˜Î”subscriptğ‘¾ğ‘˜subscriptğ’™ğ‘—subscriptğ’™ğ‘–ğ‘¾Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ’™ğ‘—subscriptğ’™ğ‘–ğ‘¾subscriptğ’™ğ‘—subscriptğ’™ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ’™ğ‘—\begin{split}attn^{\prime}({\bm{x}}_{i},{\bm{x}}_{j})&=\left(({\bm{W}}_{q}+% \Delta{\bm{W}}_{q}){\bm{x}}_{i}\right)^{T}({\bm{W}}_{k}+\Delta{\bm{W}}_{k}){% \bm{x}}_{j}\\ &={\bm{x}}_{i}({\bm{W}}+\Delta{\bm{W}}){\bm{x}}_{j}\\ &={\bm{x}}_{i}{\bm{W}}{\bm{x}}_{j}+{\bm{x}}_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}{\bm{x}}_{j}\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL start_CELL = ( ( bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Î” bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + roman_Î” bold_italic_W start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_W + roman_Î” bold_italic_W ) bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_W bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” bold_italic_W bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW

clâˆ’châ‰¤Î´+lnâ¡Ïµ2â¢nsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™subscriptğ‘â„ğ›¿superscriptitalic-Ïµ2ğ‘›\displaystyle c_{l}-c_{h}\leq\delta+\ln\epsilon^{2}nitalic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_Î´ + roman_ln italic_Ïµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n

else if ğ’™jsubscriptğ’™ğ‘—{\bm{x}}_{j}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a relevant token, let c=chğ‘subscriptğ‘â„c=c_{h}italic_c = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and âˆ‘kâ€²expâ¡(Ai,kâ€²)subscriptsuperscriptğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ´ğ‘–superscriptğ‘˜â€²\sum_{k^{\prime}}\exp(A_{i,k^{\prime}})âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_exp ( italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) denotes the summation of all relevant tokens, we consider a simple case where ğ’™iâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢ğ’™j=chsubscriptğ’™ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ’™ğ‘—subscriptğ‘â„{\bm{x}}_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}{\bm{x}}_{j}=c_{h}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” bold_italic_W bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and for one token ğ’™kâ¢1subscriptğ’™ğ‘˜1{\bm{x}}_{k1}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have ğ’™iâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢ğ’™kâ¢1=ch+Î´subscriptğ’™ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ’™ğ‘˜1subscriptğ‘â„ğ›¿{\bm{x}}_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}{\bm{x}}_{k1}=c_{h}+\deltabold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” bold_italic_W bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_Î´, and for all other relevant tokens we have ğ’™iâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢ğ’™k=chsubscriptğ’™ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ’™ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘â„{\bm{x}}_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}{\bm{x}}_{k}=c_{h}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” bold_italic_W bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

sâ¢oâ¢fâ¢tâ¢mâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢n^â¢(ğ’™i))â¢[j]âˆ’sâ¢oâ¢fâ¢tâ¢mâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ€²â¢(ğ’™i))â¢[j]=expâ¡(Ai,j)âˆ‘kâ€²expâ¡(Ai,kâ€²)âˆ’expâ¡(Ai,j+xiâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢xj)âˆ‘kexpâ¡(Ai,k+xiâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢xk)=expâ¡(Ai,j)âˆ‘kâ€²expâ¡(Ai,kâ€²)âˆ’expâ¡(Ai,j+xiâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢xjâˆ’c)âˆ‘kexpâ¡(Ai,k+xiâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢xkâˆ’c)=expâ¡(Ai,j)âˆ‘kâ€²expâ¡(Ai,kâ€²)âˆ’expâ¡(Ai,j)âˆ‘kexpâ¡(Ai,k+xiâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢xkâˆ’c)ğ‘ ğ‘œğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥^ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğ‘›subscriptğ’™ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘—ğ‘ ğ‘œğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘›â€²subscriptğ’™ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘—subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ´ğ‘–superscriptğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘—subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ´ğ‘–superscriptğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘—ğ‘subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜ğ‘subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptsuperscriptğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ´ğ‘–superscriptğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘—subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜ğ‘\begin{split}&\hskip 15.00002ptsoftmax(\hat{attn}({\bm{x}}_{i}))[j]-softmax(% attn^{\prime}({\bm{x}}_{i}))[j]\\ &=\frac{\exp(A_{i,j})}{\sum_{k^{\prime}}\exp(A_{i,k^{\prime}})}-\frac{\exp(A_{% i,j}+x_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}x_{j})}{\sum_{k}\exp(A_{i,k}+x_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}x_{k})% }\\ &=\frac{\exp(A_{i,j})}{\sum_{k^{\prime}}\exp(A_{i,k^{\prime}})}-\frac{\exp(A_{% i,j}+x_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}x_{j}-c)}{\sum_{k}\exp(A_{i,k}+x_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}x_{k% }-c)}\\ &=\frac{\exp(A_{i,j})}{\sum_{k^{\prime}}\exp(A_{i,k^{\prime}})}-\frac{\exp(A_{% i,j})}{\sum_{k}\exp(A_{i,k}+x_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}x_{k}-c)}\\ \end{split}start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL italic_s italic_o italic_f italic_t italic_m italic_a italic_x ( over^ start_ARG italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) [ italic_j ] - considering sâ¢oâ¢fâ¢tâ¢mâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢n^â¢(ğ’™i))â¢[j]âˆ’sâ¢oâ¢fâ¢tâ¢mâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ€²â¢(ğ’™i))â¢[j]=câ¢(1aâˆ’1b)â‰¤Ïµâ¢cağ‘ ğ‘œğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥^ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğ‘›subscriptğ’™ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘—ğ‘ ğ‘œğ‘“ğ‘¡ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘›â€²subscriptğ’™ğ‘–delimited-[]ğ‘—ğ‘1ğ‘1ğ‘italic-Ïµğ‘ğ‘softmax(\hat{attn}({\bm{x}}_{i}))[j]-softmax(attn^{\prime}({\bm{x}}_{i}))[j]=c% (\frac{1}{a}-\frac{1}{b})\leq\epsilon\frac{c}{a}italic_s italic_o italic_f italic_t italic_m italic_a italic_x ( over^ start_ARG italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n end_ARG ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) [ italic_j ] - italic_s italic_o italic_f italic_t italic_m italic_a italic_x ( italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ) [ italic_j ] = italic_c ( divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ) â‰¤ italic_Ïµ divide start_ARG italic_c end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG, c=expâ¡(Ai,j)ğ‘subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘—c=\exp(A_{i,j})italic_c = roman_exp ( italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), a=âˆ‘kâ€²expâ¡(Ai,kâ€²)ğ‘subscriptsuperscriptğ‘˜â€²subscriptğ´ğ‘–superscriptğ‘˜â€²a=\sum_{k^{\prime}}\exp(A_{i,k^{\prime}})italic_a = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_exp ( italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), b=âˆ‘kexpâ¡(Ai,k+xiâ¢Î”â¢ğ‘¾â¢xkâˆ’c)ğ‘subscriptğ‘˜subscriptğ´ğ‘–ğ‘˜subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–Î”ğ‘¾subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘˜ğ‘b=\sum_{k}\exp(A_{i,k}+x_{i}\Delta{\bm{W}}x_{k}-c)italic_b = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_exp ( italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Î” bold_italic_W italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_c )

Theorem B.4.

if there exists aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ€²â¢(xi,xj)=ğ±iâ¢(ğ–+Î”â¢ğ–)â¢ğ±jğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘›â€²subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘—subscriptğ±ğ‘–ğ–Î”ğ–subscriptğ±ğ‘—attn^{\prime}(x_{i},x_{j})={\bm{x}}_{i}({\bm{W}}+\Delta{\bm{W}}){\bm{x}}_{j}italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( bold_italic_W + roman_Î” bold_italic_W ) bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfying aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢nâ€²â¢(xi,xj)âˆ’aâ¢tâ¢tâ¢n^â¢(xi,xj)â‰¤Ïµğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡superscriptğ‘›â€²subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘—^ğ‘ğ‘¡ğ‘¡ğ‘›subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘—italic-Ïµattn^{\prime}(x_{i},x_{j})-\widehat{attn}(x_{i},x_{j})\leq\epsilonitalic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - over^ start_ARG italic_a italic_t italic_t italic_n end_ARG ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰¤ italic_Ïµ, then we need

Î´â‰²lnâ¡11âˆ’Ïµclâˆ’châ‰¤Î´+lnâ¡Ïµ2â¢nless-than-or-similar-toğ›¿11italic-Ïµsubscriptğ‘ğ‘™subscriptğ‘â„ğ›¿superscriptitalic-Ïµ2ğ‘›\begin{split}\delta&\lesssim\ln\frac{1}{1-\epsilon}\\ c_{l}-c_{h}&\leq\delta+\ln\epsilon^{2}n\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_Î´ end_CELL start_CELL â‰² roman_ln divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_Ïµ end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_CELL start_CELL â‰¤ italic_Î´ + roman_ln italic_Ïµ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_CELL end_ROW

B.3 Proof of Theorem 3.3

In the following, we make use of the quantities

Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t)=maxv^âˆˆğ’±^â¡Nv^â¢(t),Nmâ¢iâ¢nâ¢(t)=minv^âˆˆğ’±^â¡Nv^â¢(t),formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡subscript^ğ‘£^ğ’±subscriptğ‘^ğ‘£ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘–ğ‘›ğ‘¡subscript^ğ‘£^ğ’±subscriptğ‘^ğ‘£ğ‘¡N_{max}(t)=\max_{\hat{v}\in\hat{\mathcal{V}}}N_{\hat{v}}(t),\qquad N_{min}(t)=% \min_{\hat{v}\in\hat{\mathcal{V}}}N_{\hat{v}}(t),italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG âˆˆ over^ start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_i italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG âˆˆ over^ start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ,

where

Nv^â¢(t)=âˆ‘vâˆˆğ’±ğŸ™â¢{dâ¢(v,v^)â‰¤t}subscriptğ‘^ğ‘£ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘£ğ’±1ğ‘‘ğ‘£^ğ‘£ğ‘¡N_{\hat{v}}(t)=\sum_{v\in\mathcal{V}}\mathbbm{1}\{d(v,\hat{v})\leq t\}italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = âˆ‘ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v âˆˆ caligraphic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 { italic_d ( italic_v , over^ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG ) â‰¤ italic_t }

counts the number of vâˆˆğ’±ğ‘£ğ’±v\in\mathcal{V}italic_v âˆˆ caligraphic_V within a â€œdistanceâ€ tğ‘¡titalic_t of v^âˆˆğ’±^^ğ‘£^ğ’±\hat{v}\in\hat{\mathcal{V}}over^ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG âˆˆ over^ start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG.

Theorem B.5.

(Fanoâ€™s inequality with approximate recovery in Scarlett & Cevher (2019)) For any random variables v,v^ğ‘£^ğ‘£v,\hat{v}italic_v , over^ start_ARG italic_v end_ARG on the finite alphabets ğ’±,ğ’±^ğ’±^ğ’±\mathcal{V},\hat{\mathcal{V}}caligraphic_V , over^ start_ARG caligraphic_V end_ARG, we have

Peâ¢(t)â‰¥Hâ¢(ğ’—|ğ’—^)âˆ’1logâ¡|ğ’±|Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t).subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ»conditionalğ’—^ğ’—1ğ’±subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡P_{e}(t)\geq\frac{H({\bm{v}}|\hat{{\bm{v}}})-1}{\log\frac{|\mathcal{\mathcal{V% }}|}{N_{max}(t)}}.italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_v | over^ start_ARG bold_italic_v end_ARG ) - 1 end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG | caligraphic_V | end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG . (11)

Peâ¢(t)=Prâ¡(â€–ğ’›âˆ’ğ’›^â€–>t)subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘’ğ‘¡Prnormğ’›^ğ’›ğ‘¡P_{e}(t)=\Pr(||{\bm{z}}-\hat{{\bm{z}}}||>t)italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) = roman_Pr ( | | bold_italic_z - over^ start_ARG bold_italic_z end_ARG | | > italic_t ), where ğ³ğ³{\bm{z}}bold_italic_z is inferenced by some function and the input is ğ¯ğ¯{\bm{v}}bold_italic_v.

Assume the input to the feed forward layer ğ’—ğ’—{\bm{v}}bold_italic_v, the first lğ‘™litalic_l layers are used to identify the relevance and the last few layers are used for inference. The output of the first lğ‘™litalic_l layers are ğ’—lsubscriptğ’—ğ‘™{\bm{v}}_{l}bold_italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and the embedding is used to conduct inference and get the result ğ’›ğ’›{\bm{z}}bold_italic_z. So we can say that with probability pâ‰¥Hâ¢(ğ’—l|ğ’—^)âˆ’1logâ¡|ğ’®|Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t)ğ‘ğ»conditionalsubscriptğ’—ğ‘™^ğ’—1ğ’®subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡p\geq\frac{H({\bm{v}}_{l}|\hat{{\bm{v}}})-1}{\log\frac{|\mathcal{\mathcal{S}}|% }{N_{max}(t)}}italic_p â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | over^ start_ARG bold_italic_v end_ARG ) - 1 end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG | caligraphic_S | end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG the resulting embedding fails to be tğ‘¡titalic_t close to the original one i.e.,Â dâ¢(ğ³,ğ³^)â‰¤tğ‘‘ğ³^ğ³ğ‘¡d({\bm{z}},\hat{{\bm{z}}})\leq titalic_d ( bold_italic_z , over^ start_ARG bold_italic_z end_ARG ) â‰¤ italic_t, where ğ’—^^ğ’—\hat{{\bm{v}}}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_v end_ARG stands for the optimal input where all irrelevant information is filtered and all the related information is contained and ğ’›^^ğ’›\hat{{\bm{z}}}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_z end_ARG is the corresponding output..

Assume that ğ’˜^^ğ’˜\hat{{\bm{w}}}over^ start_ARG bold_italic_w end_ARG are equally distributed to each token which satisfies Iâ¢(ğ’˜i;ğ’—)=Iâ¢(ğ’˜j;ğ’—)ğ¼subscriptğ’˜ğ‘–ğ’—ğ¼subscriptğ’˜ğ‘—ğ’—I({\bm{w}}_{i};{\bm{v}})=I({\bm{w}}_{j};{\bm{v}})italic_I ( bold_italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_v ) = italic_I ( bold_italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_v ), therefore, for each document, the model holds the same probability of mistakenly identify its relevance. Let pwâ¢esubscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’p_{we}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT stands for the error probability of identify noise tokens, and Î´ğ›¿\deltaitalic_Î´ be the percentage of relevant tokens. With probability Î´â¢pwâ¢eğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’\delta p_{we}italic_Î´ italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the relevant token is mistakenly regarded as irrelevant, and with probability (1âˆ’Î´)â¢pwâ¢e1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’(1-\delta)p_{we}( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT the irrelevant token is mistakenly regarded as relevant. So there are Î´â¢(1âˆ’pwâ¢e)Î´â¢(1âˆ’pwâ¢e)+(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pwâ¢eğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’ğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’\frac{\delta(1-p_{we})}{\delta(1-p_{we})+(1-\delta)p_{we}}divide start_ARG italic_Î´ ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG percent of information about the relevant ones. Also pwâ¢esubscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’p_{we}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT percent of relevant information and 1âˆ’pwâ¢e1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’1-p_{we}1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT percent of irrelevant information are discarded, then Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—l)=((1âˆ’pwâ¢e)â‹…Î´+pwâ¢eâ‹…(1âˆ’Î´))â¢Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)ğ¼ğ’”subscriptğ’—ğ‘™â‹…1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’ğ›¿â‹…subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}}_{l})=\left((1-p_{we})\cdot\delta+p_{we}\cdot(1-\delta)% \right)I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‹… italic_Î´ + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) ) italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) are the left information about inference, among these, Î´â¢(1âˆ’pwâ¢e)Î´â¢(1âˆ’pwâ¢e)+(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pwâ¢eğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’ğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’\frac{\delta(1-p_{we})}{\delta(1-p_{we})+(1-\delta)p_{we}}divide start_ARG italic_Î´ ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG are acutally related information, others are noise information.

In this way,

Iâ¢(ğ’—l;ğ’—^)=Iâ¢(ğ’—l;ğ’”)=Î´â¢(1âˆ’pwâ¢e)Î´â¢(1âˆ’pwâ¢e)+(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pwâ¢eâ‹…((1âˆ’pwâ¢e)â‹…Î´+pwâ¢eâ‹…(1âˆ’Î´))â¢Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)=Î´â¢(1âˆ’pwâ¢e)â‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)â‰¤Î´â¢(1âˆ’Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’—âˆ’1)Hâ¢(ğ’˜))â‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)=Î´â¢(Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’—)+1Hâ¢(ğ’˜))â‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)ğ¼subscriptğ’—ğ‘™^ğ’—ğ¼subscriptğ’—ğ‘™ğ’”â‹…ğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’ğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’1ğ›¿subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’â‹…1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’ğ›¿â‹…subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—â‹…ğ›¿1subscriptğ‘ğ‘¤ğ‘’ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—â‹…ğ›¿1ğ»conditionalğ’˜ğ’—1ğ»ğ’˜ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—â‹…ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’—1ğ»ğ’˜ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—\begin{split}I({\bm{v}}_{l};\hat{{\bm{v}}})&=I({\bm{v}}_{l};{\bm{s}})\\ &=\frac{\delta(1-p_{we})}{\delta(1-p_{we})+(1-\delta)p_{we}}\cdot\left((1-p_{% we})\cdot\delta+p_{we}\cdot(1-\delta)\right)I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})\\ &=\delta(1-p_{we})\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})\\ &\leq\delta(1-\frac{H({\bm{w}}|{\bm{v}}-1)}{H({\bm{w}})})\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm% {v}})\\ &=\delta(\frac{I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}})+1}{H({\bm{w}})})\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})% \end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_I ( bold_italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; over^ start_ARG bold_italic_v end_ARG ) end_CELL start_CELL = italic_I ( bold_italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ; bold_italic_s ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = divide start_ARG italic_Î´ ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG â‹… ( ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‹… italic_Î´ + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) ) italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = italic_Î´ ( divide start_ARG italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) + 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) end_ARG ) â‹… italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_CELL end_ROW

Therefore,

Peâ¢(t)â‰¥Hâ¢(ğ’—|ğ’—^)âˆ’1logâ¡|ğ’±|Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t)=Hâ¢(ğ’—)âˆ’Iâ¢(ğ’—;ğ’—^)logâ¡|ğ’±|Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t)â‰¥Hâ¢(ğ’—)âˆ’g1â¢(Î´,Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’—))â‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)logâ¡|ğ’±|Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t)subscriptğ‘ƒğ‘’ğ‘¡ğ»conditionalğ’—^ğ’—1ğ’±subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ»ğ’—ğ¼ğ’—^ğ’—ğ’±subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡ğ»ğ’—â‹…subscriptğ‘”1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’—ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—ğ’±subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡\begin{split}P_{e}(t)&\geq\frac{H({\bm{v}}|\hat{{\bm{v}}})-1}{\log\frac{|% \mathcal{\mathcal{V}}|}{N_{max}(t)}}=\frac{H({\bm{v}})-I({\bm{v}};\hat{{\bm{v}% }})}{\log\frac{|\mathcal{\mathcal{V}}|}{N_{max}(t)}}\\ &\geq\frac{H({\bm{v}})-g_{1}(\delta,I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}}))\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm% {v}})}{\log\frac{|\mathcal{\mathcal{V}}|}{N_{max}(t)}}\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_P start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_CELL start_CELL â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_v | over^ start_ARG bold_italic_v end_ARG ) - 1 end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG | caligraphic_V | end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG = divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_v ) - italic_I ( bold_italic_v ; over^ start_ARG bold_italic_v end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG | caligraphic_V | end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_v ) - italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ , italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) ) â‹… italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG | caligraphic_V | end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW

where g1â¢(Î´,Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’—))=Î´â¢(Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’—)+1Hâ¢(ğ’˜))subscriptğ‘”1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’—ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’—1ğ»ğ’˜g_{1}(\delta,I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}}))=\delta(\frac{I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}})+1}{H({\bm% {w}})})italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ , italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) ) = italic_Î´ ( divide start_ARG italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) + 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) end_ARG )

So when there is no noise, the inference can be conducted based on tose information, then we have

Prâ¡(â€–zâˆ’z^â€–>t)â‰¥Hâ¢(ğ’—)âˆ’g1â¢(Î´,Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’—))â‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)logâ¡|ğ’±|Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t)Prâ¡(â€–zâˆ’z^â€–â‰¤t)â‰¤1âˆ’Hâ¢(ğ’—)âˆ’g1â¢(Î´,Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’—))â‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)logâ¡|ğ’±|Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t)Prnormğ‘§^ğ‘§ğ‘¡ğ»ğ’—â‹…subscriptğ‘”1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’—ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—ğ’±subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡Prnormğ‘§^ğ‘§ğ‘¡1ğ»ğ’—â‹…subscriptğ‘”1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’—ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—ğ’±subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡\begin{split}\Pr\left(||z-\hat{z}||>t\right)&\geq\frac{H({\bm{v}})-g_{1}(% \delta,I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}}))\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})}{\log\frac{|\mathcal{% \mathcal{V}}|}{N_{max}(t)}}\\ \Pr\left(||z-\hat{z}||\leq t\right)&\leq 1-\frac{H({\bm{v}})-g_{1}(\delta,I({% \bm{w}};{\bm{v}}))\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})}{\log\frac{|\mathcal{\mathcal{V}}% |}{N_{max}(t)}}\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL roman_Pr ( | | italic_z - over^ start_ARG italic_z end_ARG | | > italic_t ) end_CELL start_CELL â‰¥ divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_v ) - italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ , italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) ) â‹… italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG | caligraphic_V | end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL roman_Pr ( | | italic_z - over^ start_ARG italic_z end_ARG | | â‰¤ italic_t ) end_CELL start_CELL â‰¤ 1 - divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_v ) - italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ , italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) ) â‹… italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG | caligraphic_V | end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW

Considering the noise in the embedding of ğ’—lsubscriptğ’—ğ‘™{\bm{v}}_{l}bold_italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and the noise would have negative impact on the inference.

Also the extra noise information contained in ğ’—lsubscriptğ’—ğ‘™{\bm{v}}_{l}bold_italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is

Iâ¢(ğ’—âˆ’;ğ’—l)=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pwâ¢eÎ´â¢(1âˆ’pwâ¢e)+(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pwâ¢eâ‹…â‹…((1âˆ’pwâ¢e)â‹…Î´+pwâ¢eâ‹…(1âˆ’Î´))I(ğ’”;ğ’—)=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢pwâ¢eâ‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢Hâ¢(ğ’˜|ğ’—)âˆ’1Hâ¢(ğ’˜)â‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)\begin{split}I({\bm{v}}^{-};{\bm{v}}_{l})&=\frac{(1-\delta)p_{we}}{\delta(1-p_% {we})+(1-\delta)p_{we}}\cdot\cdot\left((1-p_{we})\cdot\delta+p_{we}\cdot(1-% \delta)\right)I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})\\ &=(1-\delta)p_{we}\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})\\ &=(1-\delta)\frac{H({\bm{w}}|{\bm{v}})-1}{H({\bm{w}})}\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}% })\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_I ( bold_italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ; bold_italic_v start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL start_CELL = divide start_ARG ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_Î´ ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG â‹… â‹… ( ( 1 - italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‹… italic_Î´ + italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) ) italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w italic_e end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w | bold_italic_v ) - 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) end_ARG â‹… italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_CELL end_ROW
Theorem B.6 (Theorem 2 of Kawaguchi etÂ al. (2023)).

Let ğ’ŸâŠ†{1,2,â€¦,D+1}ğ’Ÿ12â€¦ğ·1{\mathcal{D}}\subseteq\{1,2,\dots,D+1\}caligraphic_D âŠ† { 1 , 2 , â€¦ , italic_D + 1 }. Then, for any Î´>0ğ›¿0\delta>0italic_Î´ > 0, with probability at least 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta1 - italic_Î´ over the training set sğ‘ sitalic_s, the following generalization bound holds:

Î”â¢(s)â‰¤minlâˆˆğ’Ÿâ¡Ql,Î”ğ‘ subscriptğ‘™ğ’Ÿsubscriptğ‘„ğ‘™\displaystyle\Delta(s)\leq\min_{l\in{\mathcal{D}}}Q_{l},roman_Î” ( italic_s ) â‰¤ roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l âˆˆ caligraphic_D end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (12)

where for lâ‰¤Dğ‘™ğ·l\leq Ditalic_l â‰¤ italic_D,

Theorem B.7.

For a Feed Forward Network fğ‘“fitalic_f and the input xğ‘¥xitalic_x contains 1âˆ’Î´1ğ›¿1-\delta1 - italic_Î´ percent of noise information, assume the optimal function is f^â¢(x)^ğ‘“ğ‘¥\hat{f}(x)over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG ( italic_x ) which filter out the noise and finish the inference, then

Prâ¡(â€–fâ¢(x)âˆ’f^â¢(x)â€–>tâ€²)>Hâ¢(ğ’—)âˆ’g1â¢(Î´,Iâ¢(ğ’˜;ğ’—))â‹…Iâ¢(ğ’”;ğ’—)logâ¡|ğ’±|Nmâ¢aâ¢xâ¢(t),Prnormğ‘“ğ‘¥^ğ‘“ğ‘¥superscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ»ğ’—â‹…subscriptğ‘”1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ’˜ğ’—ğ¼ğ’”ğ’—ğ’±subscriptğ‘ğ‘šğ‘ğ‘¥ğ‘¡\begin{split}&\Pr\left(||f(x)-\hat{f}(x)||>t^{\prime}\right)>\frac{H({\bm{v}})% -g_{1}(\delta,I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}}))\cdot I({\bm{s}};{\bm{v}})}{\log\frac{|% \mathcal{\mathcal{V}}|}{N_{max}(t)}},\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL roman_Pr ( | | italic_f ( italic_x ) - over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG ( italic_x ) | | > italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) > divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_v ) - italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ , italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) ) â‹… italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG | caligraphic_V | end_ARG start_ARG italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m italic_a italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG , end_CELL end_ROW (16)

where tâ€²=t+c1â¢g2â¢(Î´,Iâ¢(ğ°;ğ¯))â‹…Iâ¢(ğ¬;ğ¯)+c2superscriptğ‘¡â€²ğ‘¡subscriptğ‘1â‹…subscriptğ‘”2ğ›¿ğ¼ğ°ğ¯ğ¼ğ¬ğ¯subscriptğ‘2t^{\prime}=t+c_{1}\sqrt{g_{2}(\delta,I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}}))\cdot I({\bm{s}};{% \bm{v}})}+c_{2}italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_t + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT square-root start_ARG italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ , italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) ) â‹… italic_I ( bold_italic_s ; bold_italic_v ) end_ARG + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. g1â¢(Î´,Iâ¢(ğ°;ğ¯))=Î´â¢(Iâ¢(ğ°;ğ¯)+1Hâ¢(ğ°))subscriptğ‘”1ğ›¿ğ¼ğ°ğ¯ğ›¿ğ¼ğ°ğ¯1ğ»ğ°g_{1}(\delta,I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}}))=\delta(\frac{I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}})+1}{H({\bm% {w}})})italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ , italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) ) = italic_Î´ ( divide start_ARG italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) + 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) end_ARG ) g2â¢(Î´,Iâ¢(ğ°;ğ¯))=(1âˆ’Î´)â¢Hâ¢(ğ°|ğ¯)âˆ’1Hâ¢(ğ°)subscriptğ‘”2ğ›¿ğ¼ğ°ğ¯1ğ›¿ğ»conditionalğ°ğ¯1ğ»ğ°g_{2}(\delta,I({\bm{w}};{\bm{v}}))=(1-\delta)\frac{H({\bm{w}}|{\bm{v}})-1}{H({% \bm{w}})}italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Î´ , italic_I ( bold_italic_w ; bold_italic_v ) ) = ( 1 - italic_Î´ ) divide start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w | bold_italic_v ) - 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_H ( bold_italic_w ) end_ARG

Appendix C Extra Layers for Filtering

C.1 Proof of Theorem 4.1

Fact C.1 (Set disjointness communication lower bound (Yao, 1979)).

Suppose Alice and Bob are given inputs a,bâˆˆ{0,1}nğ‘ğ‘superscript01ğ‘›a,b\in\{0,1\}^{n}italic_a , italic_b âˆˆ { 0 , 1 } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, respectively, with the goal of jointly computing DISJâ¢(a,b)=maxiâ¡aiâ¢biDISJğ‘ğ‘subscriptğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–subscriptğ‘ğ‘–\mathrm{DISJ}(a,b)=\max_{i}a_{i}b_{i}roman_DISJ ( italic_a , italic_b ) = roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by alternately sending a single bit message to the other party over a sequence of communication rounds. Any deterministic protocol for computing DISJâ¢(a,b)DISJğ‘ğ‘\mathrm{DISJ}(a,b)roman_DISJ ( italic_a , italic_b ) requires at least nğ‘›nitalic_n rounds of communication.

ri={0Â ifÂ â¢âˆƒa,bâ¢s.t.gâ¢(xi,xa,xb)=01Â elseÂ subscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–cases0formulae-sequenceÂ ifÂ ğ‘ğ‘ğ‘ ğ‘¡ğ‘”subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘01Â elseÂ r_{i}=\begin{cases}0&\text{ if }\ \exists\ a,b\ s.t.\ g(x_{i},x_{a},x_{b})=0\\ 1&\text{ else }\end{cases}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { start_ROW start_CELL 0 end_CELL start_CELL if âˆƒ italic_a , italic_b italic_s . italic_t . italic_g ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 0 end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL 1 end_CELL start_CELL else end_CELL end_ROW

In normal cases, judging the value of risubscriptğ‘Ÿğ‘–r_{i}italic_r start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT requires calculating gâ¢(xi,xa,xb)ğ‘”subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘g(x_{i},x_{a},x_{b})italic_g ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for all aâˆˆ[0,nd)ğ‘0subscriptğ‘›ğ‘‘a\in[0,n_{d})italic_a âˆˆ [ 0 , italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and bâˆˆ[nd,nd+nq)ğ‘subscriptğ‘›ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘›ğ‘‘subscriptğ‘›ğ‘b\in[n_{d},n_{d}+n_{q})italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). Here we simplify the question, and we consider the situation where gâ¢(xi,xa,xb)=0ğ‘”subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘–subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘¥ğ‘0g(x_{i},x_{a},x_{b})=0italic_g ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 0 only if b=a+ndğ‘ğ‘subscriptğ‘›ğ‘‘b=a+n_{d}italic_b = italic_a + italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and nq=ndsubscriptğ‘›ğ‘subscriptğ‘›ğ‘‘n_{q}=n_{d}italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Apparently, this is a special case of the original problem, and if one layer of self-attention fail to solve this, it is impossible for it to solve the original problem.

If we assume that the input is like,

ğ’™iâˆˆ{{ğ’™i}ifâ¢i=0,{0,ğ’™a}ifâ¢iâˆˆ{1,â€¦,ndâˆ’1},{0,ğ’™b}ifâ¢iâˆˆ{nd,â€¦,2â‹…ndâˆ’1}.subscriptğ’™ğ‘–casessubscriptğ’™ğ‘–ifğ‘–00subscriptğ’™ğ‘ifğ‘–1â€¦subscriptğ‘›ğ‘‘10subscriptğ’™ğ‘ifğ‘–subscriptğ‘›ğ‘‘â€¦â‹…2subscriptğ‘›ğ‘‘1{\bm{x}}_{i}\in\begin{cases}\{{\bm{x}}_{i}\}&\text{if}\ i=0,\\ \{0,{\bm{x}}_{a}\}&\text{if}\ i\in\{1,\dots,n_{d}-1\},\\ \{0,{\bm{x}}_{b}\}&\text{if}\ i\in\{n_{d},\dots,2\cdot n_{d}-1\}.\end{cases}bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ { start_ROW start_CELL { bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL if italic_i = 0 , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL { 0 , bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL if italic_i âˆˆ { 1 , â€¦ , italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 } , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL { 0 , bold_italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_b end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } end_CELL start_CELL if italic_i âˆˆ { italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , â€¦ , 2 â‹… italic_n start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 } . end_CELL end_ROW (17)
